noun.description: In India: a kind of pleasure boat used on the River Ganges, built in the shape of a peacock.

origin: Mid 18th century. From Hindi mor-paṅkhī, lit. resembling a peacock's wing from mor-paṅkh peacock's wing (from mor peacock (from Sanskrit mayūra) + -paṅkh wing) + -ī, feminine suffix forming adjectives.
